BasicShapes

Class QBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicShapes.QBox
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QBBox, QMBox, QPlatform

    public class QBox
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple Box. Has all the parameters you would expect box to have.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QBox()
      A constructor for the box.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Same as drawBox.
      void drawBox(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Draws the box into to the graphics passed, box outline will be black color.
      int getBottomY()
      Returns the object's bottom y coordinate, is used for collision detection checking.

      Returns the object's center x coordinate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QBox

        public QBox()
        A constructor for the box. QBox does not contain any offsets, it is just a box. All the values are set to 0 on creation.

    • Method Detail

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Sets the value of x to whatever you choose to.
        Parameters:
        x - the value to which x will be set to.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Return x value of the object. I return int because it is easier to use for collision detection.
        Returns:
        returns the x value of the object.

      • incrementX

        public void incrementX(double x)
        Increment the object's x value, very useful for movement.
        Parameters:
        x - the value by which to increment x by.

        public int getLeftX()

        the object's left x coordinate.

      • getRightX

        public int getRightX()
        returns the object's right x coordinate, is used for collision detection checking.
        Returns:
        the object's right x coordinate(which is x+width).

      • getTopY

        public int getTopY()
        returns the object's top y coordinate, is used for collision detection checking.
        Returns:
        the object's top y coordinate.

      • getBottomY

        public int getBottomY()
        Returns the object's bottom y coordinate, is used for collision detection checking.
        Returns:
        the object's bottom y coordinate(which is y+height).

      • getCenterX

        public int getCenterX()
        Returns the object's center x coordinate. Is used for whatever you want, but it is costly.
        Returns:
        the object's center x coordinate.

      • getCenterY

        public int getCenterY()
        Returns the object's center y coordinate. Is used for whatever you want, but it is costly.
        Returns:
        the object's center y coordinate.

      • drawBox

        public void drawBox(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws the box into to the graphics passed, box outline will be black color.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics where the box will be drawn into.
